Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the speed at which $60 billion in aid was approved after Hurricane Katrina. While some of the aid was approved within 10 days, not all of it was approved on a voice vote, as claimed.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up the assertion that all $60 billion in aid was approved on a voice vote.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the approval process for Hurricane Katrina aid was the same as the process for Hurricane Sandy aid, which may not be a valid assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that most of the $60 billion in aid after Hurricane Katrina was approved through recorded votes, not solely on a voice vote.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the approval process of Hurricane Katrina aid, which involved both voice votes and recorded votes.
